page.title: 18Transport And Parking
page.content: The main types of transport are bus and private car. The town does not have a railway station,this closed in 1970. Louth Bus Station is on Queen Street. From here you can catch a service bus to Grimsby, Mablethorpe, Skegness and Lincoln. The nearest large shopping centre is at Grimsby 15 miles away. Buses leave hourly for Grimsby and it cost's Â£2.20 Adult return and Â£1.30 Child return. Regular excursions to cities like London and to seaside resorts also leave from from the bus station but these are operated by private companies such as Appleby's. Many people use private cars so parking is hard.There are 9 carparks making about 700 spaces.The largest is in Northgate.It cost's 10p per 2 hours.Half the people in Louth thought parking in Louth was good.
